intro: Chamaeraphis composita, commonly known as the sea rocket, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean and the western coast of the United States, it thrives in saline and sandy soils. The plant's structure includes a basal rosette of leaves with a branching stem that supports its inflorescence. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh coastal environments.
